page.title: 18 COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Bury town centre has excellent links with surrounding towns through its new bus/rail interchage. Frequent electric trains depart to Manchester; and other places such as Rochdale, Bolton,and Burnley can be reached easily by bus. Bury used to be the centre of the East Lancashire Railway Co. and had two railway stations at Bolton St. and Knowsley St. these linked Bury to the above towns together with Liverpool and Leeds. Today preservationists using the company's old name are close to re-opening a stretch of line 9 miles long to Rawtenstall with the help of G.M.C. and Rossendale Council. Bury is well linked to the national motorway network through the M66 and M62. As a result one of the main industrial activities of the town is distribution with I.C.I. and M & S having large depots.
